guide.title: Stabilisation exceptions
guide.abstract: List of packages/teams that may stabilise themselves

body.p: Some packages need a special setup or hardware to be tested properly. As the architecture teams can add no real additional testing, some maintainers or teams may be allowed to mark packages stable themselves under the following conditions:

ul.li: The prerequisites of stabilisation policy still apply.
The architecture must be available in hardware to have at least a compile test.
Several USE flag combinations must be compiled.
Basic operation should be tested on the actual hardware.

body.p: Permissions can be requested by anyone with a good reason on the x86 alias. We will discuss it and give our ok/denial.
